NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Forestry and Labor or the cell corresponding to Livestock and Quality?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Forestry} and {Labor} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Dairy and Labor or the cell corresponding to Livestock and Yield?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Dairy} and {Labor} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Dairy and Labor or the cell corresponding to Livestock and Quality?

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Crops and Market Price or the cell corresponding to Dairy and Yield?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Dairy} and {Yield} has a higher heat value.

MSR.Q: In the heatmap, what are the row and column labels for all cells whose heat values fall within the range of 0.50 to 0.72?
MSR.A: The cells are: {(Poultry, Cost), (Farming Techniques, Export), (Dairy, Labor), (Soil Health, Labor), (Fisheries, Market Price), (Soil Health, Market Price), (Water Usage, Market Price), (Farming Techniques, Quality), (Fisheries, Sustainability), (Crops, Technology Adoption), (Poultry, Technology Adoption), (Crops, Yield), (Forestry, Yield), (Soil Health, Yield)}.
